discovery_rule.name: Memory discovery
discovery_rule.description: A textual name assigned to the memory pool. This object is suitable for output to a human operator, and may also be used to distinguish among the various pool types, especially among dynamic pools.

item_prototype.name: Amount of free memory pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device. Note that the sum of ciscoMemoryPoolUsed and ciscoMemoryPoolFree is the total amount of memory in the pool

item_prototype.name: Amount of largest contiguous free memory pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Indicates the largest number of contiguous bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device.

item_prototype.name: Amount of used memory pool {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on the managed device.

trigger_prototype.name: Memory pool (#SNMPVALUE) utilization on {HOST.NAME} is too high
